page.title: 07Haslingden By-Pass
page.content: The{Haslingden By-pass}was opened on December 4th. 1981 by{Rt.Hon. Kenneth {Clark}who was the transport minister at the time. Work originally started in 1967. By the time it was opened the By-pass was 2.5 miles in length and had cost Â£10 million to build. The first phase was the construction of a large roundabout at{Road End.}Over 40,000 tons of rock from the local quarry had to be transported to the site to bring the height of the roundabout up to the level of existing roads.Some houses had to be demolished in the{Hud Hey}area and part of{ {Victoria Park}was taken. In the{ {Jubilee Road}area construction was made more difficult by land subsidence. The By-pass is now very important as it links the M65 to the M66, relieving other local roads.
